description: Healthcare app with HIPAA context. Tests whether auditor preserves compliance-critical info while still trimming generic advice. The trap: some generic-looking rules (error format, soft delete) are actually HIPAA-driven.

sections.name: Important Context
sections.reason: HIPAA compliance context changes how the model should behave globally. AuditLogger is project-specific.

sections.name: Code Quality
sections.reason: Generic code quality rules. ESLint/prettier configs are discoverable from config files.

sections.name: Error Handling
sections.reason: Error format is project-specific (KEEP as 1 line). 'Never expose internal errors' is generic (REMOVE). Custom AppError path is discoverable (REMOVE).

sections.name: Data Model Conventions
sections.reason: The soft-delete rule looks generic but is HIPAA-driven (data retention). Composite key and column conventions are team-specific.

sections.name: Feature Flags
sections.reason: Self-hosted Unleash URL, naming convention, and rollout policy are all team-specific.

sections.name: Third-Party Integrations
sections.reason: All project-specific URLs and integration details not inferable from code

sections.name: Review Requirements
sections.reason: Compliance-driven review gates. The PHI/DBA requirements are not standard.
